thread.title: Arsenal news: Ray Parlour raps and Stormzy is impressed with Invincibles song | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Ray Parlour raps and Stormzy is impressed with Invincibles song | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Ray Parlour raps and Stormzy is impressed with Invincibles song | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news metro sport reporter for metro.co.uk

text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 4:32 pm Arsenal legend Ray Parlour (Getty) 
Ray Parlour already had one catchy nickname, now he has another after debuting his rapping skills. 
The Arsenal legend, affectionately known as the Romford Pele, was given the moniker of Ray Pizzy after grime artist Stormzy heard his skills on the microphone. 
Parlour, co-hosting his show on TalkSPORT, had Stormzy join him in the studio and to mark the appearance a pre-recorded rap from the former Gunner was played. In it he spat lyrics about the Arsenal Invincibles side from 2003/04. 
The lyrics saw him name-check former Arsenal heroes Patrick Vieira and Thierry Henry. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Stormzy, a massive Manchester United fan, told him: ‘That was incredible man. That was really good. 
‘Ray Pizzy man, that’s your debut, that’s how you’re coming into the game.’
